docs.snippet: Element 113 is credited to scientists from the Riken institute in Japan, who will bestow an official name more than 12 years after they began their efforts....
docs.lead_paragraph: Element 113 is credited to scientists from the Riken institute in Japan, who will bestow an official name more than 12 years after they began their efforts.
docs.abstract: Scientists from Riken institute in Japan will bestow official name on Element 113 in periodic table, upending tradition in which Europeans and Americans have monopolized process of naming elements; International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry says Japan has strongest claim to having discovered element.

headline.main: In a First, Element Will Be Named by Researchers in Japan

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, Kareem Fahim from Cairo, Ben Hubbard from Baghdad, and Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow.

docs.snippet: Islamic State's territory shrank by 40 percent from its maximum expansion in Iraq, and by 20 percent in Syria in 2015, as international forces pushed it out of several cities, the U.S.-led coalition fighting it said on Tuesday....
